benchmark_details.name: BEACON (BEnchm Ark for COmprehensive R NA Task and Language Models)
benchmark_details.overview: BEACON is the first comprehensive RNA benchmark that encompasses 13 diverse tasks spanning structural analysis, functional studies, and engineering applications, aiming to provide standardized evaluation for RNA models.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized benchmark for evaluating RNA models across various tasks and their corresponding performance in RNA understanding.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Although BEACON includes 13 diverse RNA-related tasks, it may not cover all aspects of RNA biology, necessitating further expansions in the future.

data.source: Curated collection of RNA-related tasks derived from previous studies and research papers, including databases like bpRNA-1m, RNAcontact, and others.
data.annotation: Data is compiled from multiple RNA-related research studies and databases.

metrics: Mean Columnwise Root Mean Squared Error (MCRMSE)
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the predictions versus ground truth from the datasets used in the benchmark.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better model performance across the evaluated RNA tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: ResNet and LSTM are strong naive supervised models. Pretrained RNA language models showed significant potential, with BEACON-B baseline achieving competitive results on various tasks.
methodology.validation: Tasks validated through consistent training and testing processes across multiple RNA sequences.
